result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario D Ivy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 7-4-15; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil forfeiture.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario D Ivy

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defense and Defendant.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 2 DAYS time served.  Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 7-4-2015; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil forfeiture.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24 is in trial and there are no spin courts or ADA's available.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matt Lamke involved in another matter in another court.  New court date given to defendant outside presence of Attorney Lamke.  Attorney Lamke appears and was given new date.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Mario D Ivy in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Mario D Ivy in custody.  Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
